# no-gratuitous-expressions

ðŸ’¼ This rule is enabled in the âœ… `recommended` config.

<!-- end auto-generated rule header -->

If a boolean expression doesnâ€™t change the evaluation of the condition, then it is entirely unnecessary, and can be removed. If it is gratuitous
because it does not match the programmerâ€™s intent, then itâ€™s a bug and the expression should be fixed.

## Noncompliant Code Example

```javascript
if (a) {
  if (a) { // Noncompliant
    doSomething();
  }
}
```

## Compliant Solution

```javascript
if (a) {
  if (b) {
    doSomething();
  }
}

// or
if (a) {
  doSomething();
}
```

## See

<ul>
  <li> <a href="http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/571">MITRE, CWE-571</a> - Expression is Always True </li>
  <li> <a href="http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/570">MITRE, CWE-570</a> - Expression is Always False </li>
</ul>
